snippet: Third-quarter economic growth could surprise on the upside after government data showed the goods trade deficit narrowed sharply to a seven-month low in September.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports goods trade deficit fell from $67.2 billion in August to $58.6 billion in September, lowest in seven months.
lead_paragraph: Third-quarter economic growth could surprise on the upside after government data showed the goods trade deficit narrowed sharply to a seven-month low in September.

headline.print_headline: Trade Deficit’s Fall May Mean Higher-Than-Expected G.D.P.
headline.main: Trade Deficit’s Fall May Mean Higher-Than-Expected G.D.P.
